Author: Amazon Customer
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2024
Review_Text: One of the best Lego Star Wars sets currently availableThis is one of the best Lego Star Wars sets currently available, it is extremely well designed. It is solidly built and has great action features with the rotating main turret and bubble turrets, and stud shooters. The model stays together great, and the handle is super convenient. Most of all, I appreciate that there is so much space on the inside to fit many, many troopers and their equipment. The set also comes with an awesome minifigure selection. This set is very well rounded, and one of the best lego star wars sets in recent years.

Author: Clone Wars Fan
Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2024
Review_Text: Great set but shipped without another box?Just like in The clone wars, commander Cody can lead his troops because he is COMMANDER CODY. Oh and the walker is cool too with Commander Cody. The turrets are not really tight together so they keep falling off. I love how Lego made phase 2 commander Kody Cody the set took me a 2 days but it is awsome it has great featrures for the set. I love this set! Everything arrived in good condition, but they just slapped a shipping label on the Lego box and shipped it.

Author: Star Wars Collector
Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2024
Review_Text: Many pieces and most have a Star War episode connectionThis set is packed with details from Revenge of the Sith. The minifigs are spot on, and the walker poses well for display. Took about 4 hours to build with my 10-year-old son — great bonding time.

Author: LEGO Enthusiast
Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2024
Review_Text: Solid build quality and fun play featuresThe posable legs and rotating turret make it perfect for battle scenes. Minifigs include Commander Cody, which is a must-have. Highly recommend for ages 9+.

Author: Parent Buyer
Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2024
Review_Text: Excellent value for the piece count1082 pieces for under $150? Great deal. The interior space for troops is genius. Only complaint is the bubble turrets are a bit loose.

Author: Kid Tester
Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2024
Review_Text: My son won't stop playing with it9-year-old built it mostly himself. The handle is awesome for carrying around the house. Stud shooters add to the fun.

Author: Display Collector
Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2024
Review_Text: Stunning on the shelfThe scale is perfect next to other Clone Wars sets. Details like the phase 1 and 2 clones are accurate. No regrets.

Author: Builder Dad
Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2024
Review_Text: Fun but a bit fiddly in spotsSome connections are tricky for smaller hands, but overall a solid set. Love the dwarf spider droid minifig.

Author: Star Wars Fan
Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2024
Review_Text: Recreates Battle of Utapau perfectlyEverything you need for the scene — clones, droids, and the walker. Instructions are clear, no issues.

Author: Grandpa Gift
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2024
Review_Text: Grandkid's favorite setBought for 11-year-old — he built it in one afternoon and played for days. Great quality as always.

Author: Minifig Hunter
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
Review_Text: Minifigs make it worth itCommander Cody and the clones are highlights. Walker is sturdy but could use more articulation.

Author: Playtime Mom
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
Review_Text: Hours of imaginative playThe open design lets kids add their own figures inside. Durable for rough play.

Author: Collector Series
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
Review_Text: Top-tier Star Wars LEGOBetter than the 2005 version — more details, better minifigs. Must-have for fans.

Author: First-Time Buyer
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2023
Review_Text: Good starter set for older kidsInstructions are detailed, but some steps are challenging. End result is impressive.

Author: Clone Army Builder
Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2023
Review_Text: Fits perfectly with battle packsRoom for 7 clones — pairs great with 501st or 212th packs. Epic army builder.

Author: Display Enthusiast
Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2023
Review_Text: Impressive size and detail7.5 inches tall — dominates the shelf. Rotating cannon is a nice touch.

Author: Family Builder
Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2023
Review_Text: Fun family projectTook 3 evenings with kids. The battle droid is a cool addition.

Author: Revenge of the Sith Fan
Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2023
Review_Text: Accurate to the movieCaptures the Utapau battle vibe. Cody's minifig is the star.

Author: LEGO Veteran
Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2023
Review_Text: No compromises on qualityLEGO's usual excellence — pieces fit perfectly, no color mismatches.

Author: Young Builder
Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2023
Review_Text: Challenging but rewardingAges 9+ is spot on — my 10-year-old needed help with the legs, but loved it.
